author: Justin Lahart
title: Something’s Gotta Give in the Fed’s Forecasts
text:
A big slug of fiscal stimulus will hit the economy over the next two years, but the Federal Reserve doesn’t seem all that impressed.
True, Fed policy makers have raised growth forecasts. The median forecast in the projections they released following last week’s rate-setting meeting showed gross domestic product growing 2.7% this year. That compared with a 2018 GDP forecast of 2% in September. The 2019 GDP forecast went to 2.4% from 2%. Two big things that happened between September and last week were the massive tax cut that...
